metadata.name: Malware: bad IP
metadata.value: Detection of malware based on a connection to a known bad IP address.

metadata.name: Active Scan: Log4j Vulnerable to RCE
metadata.value: Detects active Log4j vulnerabilities by identifying DNS queries for unobfuscated domains that were initiated by supported Log4j vulnerability scanners.

metadata.name: Initial Access: Anonymous GKE Resource Created from the Internet
metadata.value: Detects resource creation events from effectively anonymous internet users.

metadata.name: Initial Access: GKE Resource Modified Anonymously from the Internet
metadata.value: Detects resource manipulation events from effectively anonymous internet users.

metadata.name: Data Destruction: Google Cloud Backup and DR expire image
metadata.value: A user requested the deletion of a backup image from Backup and DR. The deletion of a backup image does not prevent future backups.

metadata.name: Data Destruction: Google Cloud Backup and DR expire all images
metadata.value: A user requested the deletion of all backup images for a protected application from Backup and DR.

metadata.name: Data Destruction: Google Cloud Backup and DR remove appliance
metadata.value: A backup appliance was deleted from Backup and DR.

metadata.name: Inhibit System Recovery: Deleted Google Cloud Backup and DR host
metadata.value: A host was deleted from Backup and DR. Applications that are associated with the deleted host might not be protected.

metadata.name: Inhibit System Recovery: Google Cloud Backup and DR remove plan
metadata.value: A backup plan with multiple policies for an application was deleted from Backup and DR. The deletion of a backup plan can prevent future backups.

metadata.name: Impact: Google Cloud Backup and DR reduced backup expiration
metadata.value: The expiration date for a backup protected by Backup and DR has been reduced.

metadata.name: Impact: Google Cloud Backup and DR reduced backup frequency
metadata.value: The Backup and DR backup schedule has been modified to reduce backup frequency.

metadata.name: Inhibit System Recovery: Deleted Google Cloud Backup and DR host
metadata.value: A host was deleted from Backup and DR.

metadata.name: Inhibit System Recovery: Google Cloud Backup and DR delete policy
metadata.value: A Backup and DR policy, which defines how a backup is taken and where it is stored, was deleted.

metadata.name: Inhibit System Recovery: Google Cloud Backup and DR delete profile
metadata.value: A Backup and DR profile, which defines which storage pools should be used to store backups, was deleted. Future backups that use the profile might fail.

metadata.name: Inhibit System Recovery: Google Cloud Backup and DR delete storage pool
metadata.value: A storage pool, which associates a Cloud Storage bucket with Backup and DR, has been removed from Backup and DR.

metadata.name: Inhibit System Recovery: Google Cloud Backup and DR delete template
metadata.value: A predefined backup template, which is used to set up backups for multiple applications, was deleted.

metadata.name: Inhibit System Recovery: Google Cloud Backup and DR remove plan
metadata.value: A backup plan with multiple policies for an application was deleted from Backup and DR.

metadata.name: Persistence: Global Startup Script Added
metadata.value: Detects when a global startup script is added to a project.

metadata.name: Persistence: Global Startup Script Added
metadata.value: Detects when a global startup script is added to a project.

metadata.name: Discovery: Can get sensitive Kubernetes object check
metadata.value: A potentially malicious actor attempted to determine what sensitive objects in GKE they can query for, by using the kubectl auth can-i get command.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Get Kubernetes CSR with compromised bootstrap credentials
metadata.value: A potentially malicious actor queried for a certificate signing request (CSR), with the kubectl command, using compromised bootstrap credentials.

metadata.name: Persistence: GCE Admin Added Startup Script
metadata.value: Detection of a modification to the Compute Engine instance metadata startup script value on an established instance (older than 1 week).

metadata.name: Persistence: GCE Admin Added Startup Script
metadata.value: Detection of a modification to the Compute Engine instance metadata startup script value on an established instance (older than 1 week).

metadata.name: Discovery: Service Account Self-Investigation
metadata.value: Detection of an IAM service account credential that is used t investigate the roles and permissions associated with that same service account.

metadata.name: Impact: Billing Disabled
metadata.value: Detects when billing has been disabled for a project.

metadata.name: Impact: Billing Disabled
metadata.value: Detects when billing has been disabled for multiple projects in an organization within a short time period.

metadata.name: Impact: Service API Disabled
metadata.value: Detects when a Google Cloud service API is disabled in a production environment.

metadata.name: Impact: VPC Firewall High Priority Block
metadata.value: Detects when a VPC firewall rule that blocks all traffic is added at priority 0.

metadata.name: Impact: VPC Firewall Mass Rule Deletion
metadata.value: Detects the mass deletion of VPC firewall rules by non-service accounts.

metadata.name: Command and Control: DNS Tunneling
metadata.value: Detects the handshake of the DNS tunneling tool Iodine.

metadata.name: Persistence: New API Method
metadata.value: Detection of anomalous usage of Google Cloud services by IAM service accounts.

metadata.name: Defense Evasion: Anonymous Sessions Granted Cluster Admin Access
metadata.value: Detects the creation of a role-based access control (RBAC) ClusterRoleBinding object adding the root-cluster-admin-binding behavior to anonymous users.

metadata.name: Exfiltration: BigQuery Data Exfiltration
metadata.value: 1) Resources owned by the protected organization that are saved outside of the organization, including copy or transfer operations. 2) Attempts to access BigQuery resources that are protected by VPC Service Controls.

metadata.name: Exfiltration: BigQuery Data Extraction
metadata.value: 1) A BigQuery resource owned by the protected organization is saved, through extraction operations, to a Cloud Storage bucket outside the organization. 2)A BigQuery resource owned by the protected organization is saved, through extraction operations, to a publicly accessible Cloud Storage bucket owned by that organization.

metadata.name: Exfiltration: BigQuery Data to Google Drive
metadata.value: A BigQuery resource owned by the protected organization is saved, through extraction operations, to a Google Drive folder.

metadata.name: Exfiltration: Move to Public BigQuery resource
metadata.value: A BigQuery resource is saved to a public resource owned by your organization.

metadata.name: Defense Evasion: Potential Kubernetes Pod Masquerading
metadata.value: Someone deployed a Pod with a naming convention similar to the default workloads that GKE creates for regular cluster operation.

metadata.name: Defense Evasion: VPC Route Masquerade Attempt
metadata.value: Detects the manual creation of VPC routes masquerading as Google Cloud default routes, allowing egress traffic to external IP addresses.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Suspicious Kubernetes Container Names - Exploitation and Escape
metadata.value: Someone deployed a Pod with a naming convention similar to common tools used for container escapes or to execute other attacks on the cluster.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Workload Created with a Sensitive Host Path Mount
metadata.value: Someone created a workload that contains a hostPath volume mount to a sensitive path on the host node's file system. Access to these paths on the host filesystem can be used to access privileged or sensitive information on the node and for container escapes. If possible, don't allow any hostPath volumes in your cluster.

metadata.name: Discovery: Unauthorized Service Account API Call
metadata.value: Detects when a service account makes an unauthorized cross-project API call.

metadata.name: Defense Evasion: Breakglass Workload Deployment Created
metadata.value: Detects the deployment of workloads that are deployed by using the break-glass flag to override Binary Authorization controls.

metadata.name: Defense Evasion: Breakglass Workload Deployment Updated
metadata.value: Detects when workloads are updated by using the break-glass flag to override Binary Authorization controls.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: ClusterRole with Privileged Verbs
metadata.value: Someone created an RBAC ClusterRole that contains the bind, escalate, or impersonate verbs. A subject that's bound to a role with these verbs can impersonate other users with higher privileges, bind to additional Roles or ClusterRoles that contain additional permissions, or modify their own ClusterRole permissions. This might lead to those subjects gaining cluster-admin privileges.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Launch of privileged Kubernetes container
metadata.value: A potentially malicious actor created a Pod that contains privileged containers or containers with privilege escalation capabilities.

metadata.name: Defense Evasion: Breakglass Workload Deployment Created
metadata.value: Detects the deployment of workloads that are deployed by using the break-glass flag to override Binary Authorization controls.

metadata.name: Defense Evasion: Breakglass Workload Deployment Updated
metadata.value: Detects when workloads are updated by using the break-glass flag to override Binary Authorization controls.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: ClusterRole with Privileged Verbs
metadata.value: Someone created an RBAC ClusterRole that contains the bind, escalate, or impersonate verbs. A subject that's bound to a role with these verbs can impersonate other users with higher privileges, bind to additional Roles or ClusterRoles that contain additional permissions, or modify their own ClusterRole permissions. This might lead to those subjects gaining cluster-admin privileges.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Launch of privileged Kubernetes container
metadata.value: A potentially malicious actor created a Pod that contains privileged containers or containers with privilege escalation capabilities.

metadata.name: Evasion: Access from Anonymizing Proxy
metadata.value: Detection of Google Cloud service modifications that originated from anonymous proxy IP addresses, like Tor IP addresses.

metadata.name: Execution: Kubernetes Pod Created with Potential Reverse Shell Arguments
metadata.value: Someone created a Pod that contains commands or arguments commonly associated with a reverse shell.

metadata.name: Defense Evasion: Manually Deleted Certificate Signing Request (CSR)
metadata.value: Someone manually deleted a certificate signing request (CSR).

metadata.name: Execution: Suspicious Exec or Attach to a System Pod
metadata.value: Someone used the exec or attach commands to get a shell or execute a command on a container running in the kube-system namespace.

metadata.name: Log4j Malware: Bad Domain
metadata.value: Detection of Log4j exploit traffic based on a connection to, or a lookup of, a known domain used in Log4j attacks.

metadata.name: Malware: bad domain
metadata.value: Detection of malware based on a connection to, or a lookup of, a known bad domain.

metadata.name: Credential Access: Failed Attempt to Approve Kubernetes Certificate Signing Request (CSR)
metadata.value: Someone attempted to manually approve a certificate signing request (CSR) but the action failed.

metadata.name: Credential Access: Manually Approved Kubernetes Certificate Signing Request (CSR)
metadata.value: Someone manually approved a certificate signing request (CSR).

metadata.name: Credential Access: Secrets Accessed In Kubernetes Namespace
metadata.value: Detects when secrets or service account tokens are accessed by a service account in the current Kubernetes namespace.

metadata.name: Impair Defenses: Strong Authentication Disabled
metadata.value: 2-step verification was disabled for the organization.

metadata.name: Impair Defenses: Two Step Verification Disabled
metadata.value: A user disabled 2-step verification.

metadata.name: Persistence: SSO Enablement Toggle
metadata.value: The Enable SSO (single sign-on) setting on the admin account was disabled.

metadata.name: Persistence: SSO Settings Changed
metadata.value: The SSO settings for the admin account were changed.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Changes to sensitive Kubernetes RBAC objects
metadata.value: To escalate privilege, a potentially malicious actor attempted to modify a ClusterRole, RoleBinding, or ClusterRoleBinding role-based access control (RBAC) object of the sensitive cluster-admin role by using a PUT or PATCH request.

metadata.name: Impair Defenses: Strong Authentication Disabled
metadata.value: 2-step verification was disabled for the organization.

metadata.name: Impair Defenses: Two Step Verification Disabled
metadata.value: A user disabled 2-step verification.

metadata.name: Persistence: SSO Enablement Toggle
metadata.value: The Enable SSO (single sign-on) setting on the admin account was disabled.

metadata.name: Persistence: SSO Settings Changed
metadata.value: The SSO settings for the admin account were changed.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Changes to sensitive Kubernetes RBAC objects
metadata.value: To escalate privilege, a potentially malicious actor attempted to modify a ClusterRole, RoleBinding, or ClusterRoleBinding role-based access control (RBAC) object of the sensitive cluster-admin role by using a PUT or PATCH request.

metadata.name: Persistence: Service Account Key Created
metadata.value: Detects the creation of a service account key. Service account keys are long-lived credentials that increase the risk of unauthorized access to Google Cloud resources.

metadata.name: Persistence: Service Account Key Created
metadata.value: Detects the creation of a service account key. Service account keys are long-lived credentials that increase the risk of unauthorized access to Google Cloud resources.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Creation of sensitive Kubernetes bindings
metadata.value: To escalate privilege, a potentially malicious actor attempted to create a new RoleBinding or ClusterRoleBinding object for the cluster-admin role.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Creation of sensitive Kubernetes bindings
metadata.value: To escalate privilege, a potentially malicious actor attempted to create a new RoleBinding or ClusterRoleBinding object for the cluster-admin role.

metadata.name: Persistence: GCE Admin Added SSH Key
metadata.value: Detection of a modification to the Compute Engine instance metadata ssh key value on an established instance (older than 1 week).

metadata.name: Persistence: GCE Admin Added SSH Key
metadata.value: Detection of a modification to the Compute Engine instance metadata ssh key value on an established instance (older than 1 week).

metadata.name: Initial Access: Government Based Attack
metadata.value: Government-backed attackers might have tried to compromise a user account or computer.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: AlloyDB Database Superuser Writes to User Tables
metadata.value: Detects events where an AlloyDB for PostgreSQL superuser (postgres) writes to non-system tables.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: AlloyDB Over-Privileged Grant
metadata.value: Detects events where an AlloyDB for PostgreSQL user or role has been granted all privileges to a database, or to all tables, procedures, or functions in a schema.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Anomalous Impersonation of Service Account for Admin Activity
metadata.value: Detects when a potentially anomalous impersonated service account is used for an administrative activity.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Anomalous Multistep Service Account Delegation for Admin Activity
metadata.value: Detects when an anomalous multistep delegated request is found for an administrative activity.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Anomalous Multistep Service Account Delegation for Data Access
metadata.value: Detects when an anomalous multistep delegated request is found for a data access activity.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Anomalous Service Account Impersonator for Admin Activity
metadata.value: Detects when a potentially anomalous caller/impersonator in a delegation chain is used for an administrative activity.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Anomalous Service Account Impersonator for Data Access
metadata.value: Detects when a potentially anomalous caller/impersonator in a delegation chain is used for a data access activity.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Effectively Anonymous Users Granted GKE Cluster Access
metadata.value: omeone created an RBAC binding that references one of the following users or groups:  system:anonymous system:unauthenticated system:authenticated

metadata.name: Credential Access: External Member Added To Privileged Group
metadata.value: Detects events where an external member is added to a privileged Google Group (a group granted sensitive roles or permissions)

metadata.name: Credential Access: Privileged Group Opened To Public
metadata.value: Detects events where a privileged Google Group (a group granted sensitive roles or permissions) is changed to be accessible to the general public.

metadata.name: Credential Access: Sensitive Role Granted To Hybrid Group
metadata.value: Detects events where sensitive roles are granted to a Google Group with external members.

metadata.name: Credenitial Access: Account Disabled Hijacked
metadata.value: A user's account was suspended due to suspicious activity.

metadata.name: Initial Access: Disabled Password Leak
metadata.value: A user's account is disabled because a password leak was detected.

metadata.name: Initial Access: Dormant Service Account Action
metadata.value: Detects events where a dormant user-managed service account triggered an action. In this context, a service account is considered dormant if it has been inactive for more than 180 days.

metadata.name: Initial Access: Dormant Service Account Key Created
metadata.value: Detects events where a key is created for a dormant user-managed service account. In this context, a service account is considered dormant if it has been inactive for more than 180 days.

metadata.name: Initial Access: Excessive Permission Denied Actions
metadata.value: Detects events where a principal repeatedly triggers permission denied errors by attempting changes across multiple methods and services.

metadata.name: Initial Access: Leaked Service Account Key Used
metadata.value: Detects events where a leaked service account key is used to authenticate the action. In this context, a leaked service account key is one that was posted on the public internet.

metadata.name: Initial Access: Suspicious Login Blocked
metadata.value: A suspicious login to a user's account was detected and blocked.

metadata.name: Persistence: IAM Anomalous Grant
metadata.value: Detection of privileges granted to IAM users and service accounts that are not members of your organization

metadata.name: Persistence: Impersonation Role Granted For Dormant Service Account
metadata.value: Detects events where a principal is granted permissions to impersonate a dormant user-managed service account. In this context, a service account is considered dormant if it has been inactive for more than 180 days.

metadata.name: Persistence: New Geography
metadata.value: Detection of IAM user and service accounts accessing Google Cloud from anomalous locations, based on the geolocation of the requesting IP addresses.

metadata.name: Persistence: New User Agent
metadata.value: Detection of IAM service accounts accessing Google Cloud from anomalous or suspicious user agents.

metadata.name: Persistence: Unmanaged Account Granted Sensitive Role
metadata.value: Detection of a sensitive role being granted to an unmanaged account.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Dormant Service Account Granted Sensitive Role
metadata.value: Detects events where a dormant user-managed service account was granted one or more sensitive IAM roles. In this context, a service account is considered dormant if it has been inactive for more than 180 days.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Global Shutdown Script Added
metadata.value: Detects when a global shutdown script is added to a project.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: New Service Account is Owner or Editor
metadata.value: Detects when a new service account is created with Editor or Owner roles for a project.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Suspicious Cross-Project Permission Use
metadata.value: Detects cross-project use of the datafusion.instances.create IAM permission.

metadata.name: Credential Access: External Member Added To Privileged Group
metadata.value: Detects events where an external member is added to a privileged Google Group (a group granted sensitive roles or permissions)

metadata.name: Initial Access: Dormant Service Account Action
metadata.value: Detects events where a dormant user-managed service account triggered an action. In this context, a service account is considered dormant if it has been inactive for more than 180 days.

metadata.name: Initial Access: Dormant Service Account Key Created
metadata.value: Detects events where a key is created for a dormant user-managed service account. In this context, a service account is considered dormant if it has been inactive for more than 180 days.

metadata.name: Initial Access: Excessive Permission Denied Actions
metadata.value: Detects events where a principal repeatedly triggers permission denied errors by attempting changes across multiple methods and services.

metadata.name: Initial Access: Leaked Service Account Key Used
metadata.value: Detects events where a leaked service account key is used to authenticate the action. In this context, a leaked service account key is one that was posted on the public internet.

metadata.name: Initial Access: Suspicious Login Blocked
metadata.value: A suspicious login to a user's account was detected and blocked.

metadata.name: Persistence: IAM Anomalous Grant
metadata.value: Detection of privileges granted to IAM users and service accounts that are not members of your organization

metadata.name: Persistence: Impersonation Role Granted For Dormant Service Account
metadata.value: Detects events where a principal is granted permissions to impersonate a dormant user-managed service account. In this context, a service account is considered dormant if it has been inactive for more than 180 days.

metadata.name: Persistence: New Geography
metadata.value: Detection of IAM user and service accounts accessing Google Cloud from anomalous locations, based on the geolocation of the requesting IP addresses.

metadata.name: Persistence: New User Agent
metadata.value: Detection of IAM service accounts accessing Google Cloud from anomalous or suspicious user agents.

metadata.name: Persistence: Unmanaged Account Granted Sensitive Role
metadata.value: Detection of a sensitive role being granted to an unmanaged account.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Dormant Service Account Granted Sensitive Role
metadata.value: Detects events where a dormant user-managed service account was granted one or more sensitive IAM roles. In this context, a service account is considered dormant if it has been inactive for more than 180 days.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Global Shutdown Script Added
metadata.value: Detects when a global shutdown script is added to a project.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: New Service Account is Owner or Editor
metadata.value: Detects when a new service account is created with Editor or Owner roles for a project.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Suspicious Cross-Project Permission Use
metadata.value: Detects cross-project use of the datafusion.instances.create IAM permission.

metadata.name: Brute force SSH
metadata.value: Detection of successful brute force of SSH on a host.

metadata.name: Brute force SSH
metadata.value: Detection of successful brute force of SSH on a host.

metadata.name: Brute force SSH
metadata.value: Detection of successful brute force of SSH on a host.

metadata.name: Brute force SSH
metadata.value: Detection of successful brute force of SSH on a host.

metadata.name: Initial Access: Database Superuser Writes to User Tables
metadata.value: Detects events where a Cloud SQL superuser (postgres for PostgreSQL servers or root for MySQL users) writes to non-system tables.

metadata.name: Initial Access: Database Superuser Writes to User Tables
metadata.value: Detects events where a Cloud SQL superuser (postgres for PostgreSQL servers or root for MySQL users) writes to non-system tables.

metadata.name: Initial Access: Database Superuser Writes to User Tables
metadata.value: Detects events where a Cloud SQL superuser (postgres for PostgreSQL servers or root for MySQL users) writes to non-system tables.

metadata.name: Initial Access: Database Superuser Writes to User Tables
metadata.value: Detects events where a Cloud SQL superuser (postgres for PostgreSQL servers or root for MySQL users) writes to non-system tables.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Workload with shareProcessNamespace enabled
metadata.value: Someone deployed a workload with the shareProcessNamespace option set to true, allowing all containers to share the same Linux process namespace. This could allow an untrusted or compromised container to escalate privileges by accessing and controlling environment variables, memory, and other sensitive data from processes running in other containers.

metadata.name: Lateral Movement: Modified Boot Disk Attached to Instance
metadata.value: Detects when a boot disk is detached from one Compute Engine instance and attached to another, which could indicate a malicious attempt to compromise the system using a modified boot disk.

metadata.name: Lateral Movement: OS Patch Execution From Service Account
metadata.value: Detects when a service account uses the Compute Engine Patch feature to update the operating system of any currently running Compute Engine instance.

metadata.name: Log4j Malware: Bad IP
metadata.value: Detection of Log4j exploit traffic based on a connection to a known IP address used in Log4j attacks.

metadata.name: Malware: bad IP
metadata.value: Detection of malware based on a connection to a known bad IP address.

metadata.name: Impact: Managed Instance Group Autoscaling Set To Maximum
metadata.value: Detects when a managed instance group is configured for maximum autoscaling.

metadata.name: Impact: Suspicious Kubernetes Container Names - Coin Mining
metadata.value: Someone deployed a Pod with a naming convention similar to common cryptocurrency coin miners.

metadata.name: Malware: Cryptomining Bad Domain
metadata.value: Detection of cryptomining based on a connection to, or a lookup of, a known mining domain.

metadata.name: Malware: Cryptomining Bad IP
metadata.value: Detection of cryptomining based on a connection to a known mining IP address.

metadata.name: Resource Development: Offensive Security Distro Activity
metadata.value: Detects successful Google Cloud resource manipulations from known penetration testing or offensive security distros.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Create Kubernetes CSR for master cert
metadata.value: A potentially malicious actor created a Kubernetes master certificate signing request (CSR), which gives them cluster-admin access.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Create Kubernetes CSR for master cert
metadata.value: A potentially malicious actor created a Kubernetes master certificate signing request (CSR), which gives them cluster-admin access.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Suspicious Token Generation
metadata.value: Detects when the iam.serviceAccounts.implicitDelegation permission is abused to generate access tokens from a more privileged service account.

metadata.name: Privilege Escalation: Suspicious Token Generation
metadata.value: Detects when the iam.serviceAccounts.implicitDelegation permission is abused to generate access tokens from a more privileged service account.

metadata.name: Discovery: Information Gathering Tool Used
metadata.value: Detects the use of ScoutSuite, a cloud security auditing tool that is known to be used by threat actors.

metadata.name: Defense Evasion: Modify VPC Service Control
metadata.value: Detects a change to an existing VPC Service Controls perimeter that would lead to a reduction in the protection offered by that perimeter.

metadata.name: Defense Evasion: Modify VPC Service Control
metadata.value: Detects a change to an existing VPC Service Controls perimeter that would lead to a reduction in the protection offered by that perimeter.

metadata.name: Defense Evasion: Modify VPC Service Control
metadata.value: Detects a change to an existing VPC Service Controls perimeter that would lead to a reduction in the protection offered by that perimeter.

metadata.name: (SHA) SSL_NOT_ENFORCED
metadata.value: A Cloud SQL database instance doesn't require all incoming connections to use SSL.

metadata.name: (SHA) WEAK_SSL_POLICY
metadata.value: A Compute Engine instance has a weak SSL policy or uses the Google Cloud default SSL policy with TLS version less than 1.2.

metadata.name: (SHA) SSL_NOT_ENFORCED
metadata.value: A Cloud SQL database instance doesn't require all incoming connections to use SSL.

metadata.name: (SHA) WEAK_SSL_POLICY
metadata.value: A Compute Engine instance has a weak SSL policy or uses the Google Cloud default SSL policy with TLS version less than 1.2.

metadata.name: (SHA) Open RDP port
metadata.value: Firewall rules that allow any IP address to connect to RDP ports might expose your RDP services to attackers.

metadata.name: (SHA) Open SSH port
metadata.value: Firewall rules that allow any IP address to connect to SSH ports might expose your SSH services to attackers.

metadata.name: Command and Control: DNS Tunneling
metadata.value: Detects the handshake of the DNS tunneling tool Iodine.

metadata.name: (SHA) OPEN_FIREWALL
metadata.value: Firewall rules that allow connections from all IP addresses, like 0.0.0.0/0, or from all ports can unnecessarily expose resources to attacks from unintended sources.

metadata.name: Lateral Movement: Modified Boot Disk Attached to Instance
metadata.value: Detects when a boot disk is detached from one Compute Engine instance and attached to another, which could indicate a malicious attempt to compromise the system using a modified boot disk.

metadata.name: Discovery: Information Gathering Tool Used
metadata.value: Detects the use of ScoutSuite, a cloud security auditing tool that is known to be used by threat actors.

metadata.name: Discovery: Unauthorized Service Account API Call
metadata.value: Detects when a service account makes an unauthorized cross-project API call.

metadata.name: Discovery: Service Account Self-Investigation
metadata.value: Detection of an IAM service account credential that is used t investigate the roles and permissions associated with that same service account.

metadata.name: INFORMATION_GATHERING_TOOL_USED
metadata.value: Detects the use of ScoutSuite, a cloud security auditing tool that is known to be used by threat actors.

metadata.name: Defense Evasion: Breakglass Workload Deployment Created
metadata.value: Detects the deployment of workloads that are deployed by using the break-glass flag to override Binary Authorization controls.

metadata.name: Defense Evasion: Breakglass Workload Deployment Updated
metadata.value: Detects when workloads are updated by using the break-glass flag to override Binary Authorization controls.

metadata.name: Defense Evasion: Breakglass Workload Deployment Created
metadata.value: Detects the deployment of workloads that are deployed by using the break-glass flag to override Binary Authorization controls.

metadata.name: Defense Evasion: Breakglass Workload Deployment Updated
metadata.value: Detects when workloads are updated by using the break-glass flag to override Binary Authorization controls.

metadata.value: A suspicious login to a user's account was detected and blocked.
